file_content.text: Sir, Yuun would like to express again the sublime honor of joining you in Havoc Squad.
It fills Yuun with pride to walk this path of honor at your side, and share your search for the victory upon which so much depends.
Havoc Squad was lucky to get you, Yuun.
I'm glad to have you.
Yuun was brought to this joining by necessity, not probability.
I feel exactly the same way.
Um... yeah!
If you're going to serve in Havoc, I need you to act normal.
Tone down the weirdness.
Yuun acts just as any other Gand would, sir.
Among the Gand, recognition is drawn from achievements like this. Recognition requires specificity, and hence, the addition of names.
This honor is very great--perhaps great enough, in time, for Yuun to earn a second name among the Gand.
Havoc is the place to be for tough challenges and big wins.
We do accomplish a lot.
Great achievements may lie ahead, or they may not. Yuun's only true concern is to follow the path laid out before him.
You're not with the Gand now, Yuun. Call yourself whatever you want.
You shouldn't have to earn it.
Yuun is proud to carry on the traditions of the Gand.
Your time is appreciated, sir. Yuun would appreciate a few moments alone now, to meditate on what is to come.
Do I really need to know the details of your culture, Yuun?
Not my concern.
Yuun will not tell what you do not wish to hear, sir.
We have walked a long path together, sir. You have been friend, mentor, guide, and questioner.
On Gand, one who shows the commitment to friendship that you have shown would be called Tarnuur.
Yuun is proud to call you Tarnuur, sir.
You're a good friend and a good comrade, Yuun.
Likewise.
You're a good friend too, Yuun, even if you are kind of odd.
You're weird, but I like it.
Yuun does not quite understand, but your friendship is appreciated nonetheless.
Yeah, yeah, you're all right too, Yuun. Let's just get back to work.
Enough sappy stuff.
Whatever path you may walk, Yuun will be proud to walk with you.
Anyone you call friend, Yuun will call friend. Your family will be protected just as Yuun's own.
You are Tarnuur. Now, and forever.
Yuun returns in success, sir! The ritual is complete--the Zaviir was found, but more importantly, the destination was reached.
Yuun now sees the world with a clarity that never before seemed possible. It is a sensation--an awareness--unlike any other.
It's great to hear that things went well, Yuun.
I'm glad you were successful.
Yuun cannot express the fullness of appreciation necessary for your understanding at a transitional time like this.
I'm sure that's very nice.
Sounds... interesting.
It is beyond description.
Does this mean we're done with your crazy rituals?
Can we get back to work now?
This ritual is complete, yes. What other rituals may lie ahead, Yuun cannot say.
Yuun is eager to test the fullness of this newfound clarity. Our path lies before us--let us proceed.
Sir, the time has come.
Yuun's recent meditations have all led to the same conclusion. The Zaviir-juna must proceed at our earliest opportunity.
I'm sorry, I don't know what "Zaviir-juna" means.
Zaviir-juna?
Just tell me what needs to happen.
Anything you need.
Yuun appreciates your consideration.
This isn't a good time for your craziness, Yuun.
Whatever it is: no.
Yuun does not ask that we leave at this very moment. Simply at our first chance.
To be a Findsman is not a singular state of being--there are many gradations that reveal themselves to the Findsman over time.
Zaviir-juna is the trial that Yuun must complete to advance in the Findsman art. It is a hunt for the greatest Findsman of all: the Zaviir.
Is there any way I can lend a hand?
How can I help?
You have to hunt down the best hunter around?
Sounds tough.
Yes. It is one of the highest tests in the Findsman tradition.
Is this some weird assassination ritual?
Seek and destroy?
No. The task is to locate the Zaviir only.
Unfortunately, the path of the Zaviir-juna is a solitary one. Though Yuun would welcome your companionship, this goal must be sought alone.
Yuun will prepare to set out immediately, and return as soon as this path's end is found.
I hope you find what you're looking for.
Good luck.
Yuun appreciates your support and understanding, sir.
Yeah, you do that. Sure.
Um... if you say so.
Yuun appreciates your understanding, sir.
This isn't a good time for you to be going out on leave, Sergeant.
I'm not happy about this.
Yuun regrets any inconvenience, sir. But the Zaviir-juna cannot be delayed.
Yuun will set out as soon as it is convenient to our mission.
The joining of Havoc Squad has served as a mirror to Yuun's first steps on the path of the Republic Army.
In working as a Findsman, Yuun found signs leading away from Gand, out into the galaxy at large. This path could not be ignored.
But Yuun was little prepared for the truth of the galaxy. Learning new cultures, new languages, and new ways took time and patience.
What led you to sign up for the army?
When did you enlist?
Being the only Gand around can't have been fun.
Must have been lonely.
Not so, sir. Yuun enjoyed the challenge of understanding, though it was a challenge nonetheless.
I hate to imagine what you were like when you first left Gand.
You used to be even weirder?
As does Yuun. Once the lessons of the past are learned, dwelling there brings only harm.
War was a very great adjustment. The notion is not foreign to the Gand, but the scale of conflict was difficult to comprehend.
Once Yuun understood the goals of the Empire, the purpose of the signs became clear. Yuun enlisted to find the Empire's end--to stop those who would destroy so much.
Havoc isn't going to stop until the Empire is history.
That's why we're here.
Did the enlistment officers know what to do with you?
What did the recruiters say?
There was some initial confusion, but Yuun's purpose became clear in a short time.
It is strange to think back on Yuun's first hunts, and compare them with our present causes.
The victory we seek now is of truly vast importance--and Yuun is proud to be a part of it.
If we're going to bring down the Imps, let's get to it.
Talking won't get it done.
Indeed, sir. Yuun is ready to proceed.
Repetition of a pattern has drawn Yuun's attention. Swirls of dust on the bulkhead. A coil of wires bearing power forward, but also back.
The twist of these patterns back upon themselves leads Yuun into a state of reflection on what is past.
Would you share in this reflection? Would you hear how Yuun earned this name?
How did you come to be called "Yuun"?
Tell me about it.
I can spare a few minutes, sure.
I guess I could.
As Yuun explained, the Gand give names as recognition for achievements. Yuun's achievement was the completion of Findsman training.
The Findsman tradition is ancient. Few have the vision necessary to follow the Findsman ways, and fewer still ever master them.
I've definitely been impressed with your work.
You seem very skilled.
Yuun is honored to know this, sir.
How does being a Findsman work exactly?
What does a Findsman do?
You have seen it first hand, sir. Findsmen embrace the knowledge present in all things to locate whatever they might seek.
Maybe there just aren't many Gand crazy enough to believe this stuff.
Sounds like bunk to me.
The Findsman profession is held with very high regard in Gand culture.
On Gand and elsewhere, Findsmen are employed to hunt criminals, recover missing persons, and find objects lost due to disasters or hardships.
Yuun proved proficient in these tasks, and the teachers found Yuun's proclivity for technology innovative. The reward was the title of Findsman, and the name of Yuun.
What led you to join the army?
How did you end up here?
The signs guide Yuun in all things.
Is it hard being so far from home?
Do you miss your homeworld?
Yuun imagines it is no harder than for anyone else who follows a path of duty.
Our time of reflection is past. Yuun appreciates your sharing of time.
We'd better finish this up later, Yuun.
Let's get back to work.
As you wish, sir.
This isn't story time, Yuun. We've got work to do.
We don't have time for this.
Then Yuun will reflect in solitude.
When we next return to our ship, Yuun would appreciate a moment of your time, sir.
Yuun would share a few words with you at our next opportunity, sir.
Yuun has nothing to speak of at this time, sir.
Yuun remains, sir.
You require Yuun's attentions?
Few paths are free of stones.
As the roots of trees, our pasts can grow in significance.
Yuun contemplates, but does not wander.
As much as we see, more remains hidden.
Your steps lead, Yuun's steps follow.
To see the enemy, one must see oneself as the enemy.
Only in war can logic and madness further each other's ends.
Even stillness is relative.
Honor is a result, not a goal.
Beauty evolves in both order and chaos.
Motion does not hinder sight, only comprehension.
Feet tread where we will them.
Action and contemplation must not be opposed.
Yuun serves as directed.
